API¶

Package¶

Public exports for wss_py_wrapper.

This package provides a thin Python wrapper around a .NET WSS stimulation interface. Most runtime behavior is implemented in wss_py_wrapper.stimulation_controller.StimulationController.

class wss_py_wrapper.StimulationController(config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Python wrapper around the WSS .NET stimulation controller layers.

Lifecycle: - Call Initialize() before using any stimulation methods. - Call Shutdown() to stop the background tick thread and dispose .NET objects.

Threading: - A background tick loop calls Tick() at config.tick_interval_ms. - Methods are guarded by an internal lock at key lifecycle transitions.

Parameters:

config (WssConfig) – Wrapper configuration.

AddOrUpdateStimParam(key, value)[source]¶
Parameters:

  • key (str)

  • value (float)

Return type:

None

Whether the optional “Basic” .NET API is available.

Initialize()[source]¶

Load .NET DLLs, initialize layers, and start the tick loop.

This method is safe to call multiple times; subsequent calls are no-ops once initialized.

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If required DLLs cannot be found.

  • RuntimeError – If required .NET types cannot be imported.

Return type:

None

Shutdown()[source]¶

Stop stimulation, stop the tick loop, and dispose .NET objects.

Exceptions during shutdown are logged (when possible) but do not prevent the remainder of cleanup.

Return type:

None

StartStimulation()[source]¶

Broadcast a start stimulation command.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If called before Initialize().

Return type:

None

Started()[source]¶
Return type:

bool

StimWithMode(finger, magnitude)[source]¶

Stimulate using the active mode/model parameters.

Parameters:

  • finger (str) – Finger name (e.g. "index") or channel alias (e.g. "ch2").

  • magnitude (float) – Normalized magnitude.

Return type:

None

StimulateAnalog(finger, PW, amp=3, IPI=10)[source]¶

Send a direct analog stimulation request.

Parameters:

  • finger (str) – Finger name (e.g. "index") or channel alias (e.g. "ch2").

  • PW (int) – Pulse width (units defined by the .NET interface).

  • amp (int) – Amplitude (units defined by the .NET interface).

  • IPI (int) – Inter-pulse interval (units defined by the .NET interface).

Raises:

RuntimeError – If called before Initialize().

Return type:

None

StimulateNormalized(finger, magnitude)[source]¶

Stimulate a channel with a normalized magnitude.

Parameters:

  • finger (str) – Finger name (e.g. "thumb") or channel alias (e.g. "ch1").

  • magnitude (float) – Normalized magnitude as defined by the .NET interface.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If called before Initialize().

Return type:

None

StopStimulation()[source]¶

Broadcast a stop stimulation command.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If called before Initialize().

Return type:

None

TryGetStimParam(key)[source]¶
Parameters:

key (str)

UpdateChannelParams(finger, max_val, min_val, amp)[source]¶

Update per-channel stimulation parameters.

This writes values under keys like stim.ch.<ch>.maxPW.

Parameters:

  • finger (str) – Finger name or channel alias.

  • max_val (int) – Maximum pulse width.

  • min_val (int) – Minimum pulse width.

  • amp (int) – Channel amplitude.

Raises:

ValueError – If the channel is invalid for the current configuration.

Return type:

None

resetRadio()[source]¶

Restart the .NET core without reloading DLLs.

This shuts down and re-initializes the underlying .NET object and restarts the tick loop.

Return type:

None

updateWaveform(*args)[source]¶
Return type:

None

class wss_py_wrapper.WssConfig(config_path, log_path, cs_lib_dir, serial_port=None, test_mode=False, max_setup_tries=5, tick_interval_ms=10)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration for StimulationController.

Parameters:

  • config_path (Path) – Directory containing JSON configuration files consumed by the .NET layers.

  • log_path (Path) – Path for the C# log sink output.

  • cs_lib_dir (Path) – Directory containing WSS .dll files.

  • serial_port (str | None) – Optional fully-qualified serial device name; None enables auto-detect.

  • test_mode (bool) – Whether to enable simulated transport.

  • max_setup_tries (int) – Maximum number of setup retries used by the .NET core.

  • tick_interval_ms (int) – Background tick interval in milliseconds.

config_path: Path¶
cs_lib_dir: Path¶
classmethod default(main_file)[source]¶

Create a default config using the current working directory.

The returned config uses Path.cwd() / 'Config' for config_path and discovers cs_lib_dir by searching upward for Cs_Libraries/.

Parameters:

main_file (Path) – File used to anchor log naming and initial DLL search.

Returns:

A default configuration instance.

Return type:

WssConfig

log_path: Path¶
max_setup_tries: int = 5¶
serial_port: str | None = None¶
test_mode: bool = False¶
tick_interval_ms: int = 10¶
class wss_py_wrapper.WssLoader(dll_paths)[source]¶

Bases: object

Load .NET DLL references via pythonnet.

Parameters:

dll_paths (Iterable[Path]) – Iterable of DLL paths to add via clr.AddReference.

load()[source]¶

Load the WSS interface DLLs via pythonnet.

This attempts to load a pythonnet runtime and then adds references for each path passed to the loader.

Return type:

None

Controller¶

High-level controller wrapping the .NET stimulation stack.

This module contains the interop-heavy runtime core. The main entry point is StimulationController.

class wss_py_wrapper.stimulation_controller.StimulationController(config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Python wrapper around the WSS .NET stimulation controller layers.

Lifecycle: - Call Initialize() before using any stimulation methods. - Call Shutdown() to stop the background tick thread and dispose .NET objects.

Threading: - A background tick loop calls Tick() at config.tick_interval_ms. - Methods are guarded by an internal lock at key lifecycle transitions.

Parameters:

config (WssConfig) – Wrapper configuration.
